result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**AMENDED 08-15-2022:  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.P., d.o.b. 05-07-2012.  NO PHYSICAL DISCIPLINE.**

2:18 PM (64-06) Defendant Jaime Jijon Baltazar in court.  Attorney Craig Mastantuono in court for Jaime Jijon Baltazar.  Attorney James T. Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Information will mirror the Complaint.
Attorney Mastantuono enters a not guilty plea on behalf of his client.

Motion for Amendment of Bond - Attorney Mastantuono states agreement reached with the State on the record.
State agrees. 
Bond will be amended - No violent contact with individual mention in the bond and no physical discipline.

**AMENDED 8-15-22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.P. d.o.b. 5-7-2012. NO PHYSICAL DISCIPLINE.** 

*AMENDMENT 6/15/2022: MAY HAVE SUPERVISED CONTACT WITH J.P. dob 5-7-2012 AS DIRECTED BY HHS. 

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH (ALREADY POSTED)

No physical discipline of any child. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.P. dob 5-7-2012. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Jaime Jijon Baltazar in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes only. State is asking for cash. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
